text: It would be cool if we could filter and/or sort by template in content staging. Sometimes I need to update all pages that use a specific template and that requires a lot of jumping around at the moment.

*One more idea:* has the HubSpot team considered adding a kudos or badge system to this Slack group? This community is pretty active but occasionally some questions go unanswered. At the moment people usually help or answer because they are awesome so I guess it could backfire...

Reminder: Friendly reminder - <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Ideas/ct-p/ideas|submit your ideas to the idea forum> and post the link here with your idea. The votes for a feature help HubSpotters understand the demand. Thank you for all of your awesome ideas and feedback, we are listening and appreciate it.
We have discussed this and its something on our radar to look more into. Just curious, how would you picture something like that working (as we are always looking for other ideas as well)?
I'll think about it. The ideal solution for me is to message the hell out of official HubSpot folks at all times of the day...assuming that's a bad idea...

as long as its 3AM and they go to <@UD53A9UUR> :stuck_out_tongue:  (joking)

Let me know if you think of anything. We’ll also keep thinking on our end as well. The hardest part of implementing something is making sure others use it also (ex: emojis and such).
Maybe something along the lines of people giving "kudos" to your answers and then you can "pay" those kudos towards your own future questions to encourage an "official" answer or highlighted question
3am is when I am operating at full speed :wink:
As aj said, this is definitely on our radar.

Quick self-serving example, I have a question in the "beta-sections" channel that's a blocker for me at the moment. If I could "bump" it by answering other questions or by "paying" with previous questions I've answered that would be amazing
maybe when you answer a question it unlocks a special emoji (that has limited use and/or special attention grabbing powers)
